content: reversible zigzag eyelet lace scarf by laura evans i have a pet peeve about right- side/wrong-side designs for objects that inevitably will be seen on both sides at least when i wear them i ve been known to scour the photos of a pattern i like and reject ones where the item seems to be carefully arranged so that the wrong side doesn t appear in any of the photos the lace pattern for this scarf is modified from the zigzag eyelet pattern in barbara walker s first treasury of knitting patterns and is fully reversible the pattern creates alternating vertical columns of stockinette and reverse stockinette with the lace patterning worked in the knit stitches of every row it can be modified easily for a narrower or wider and/or shorter or longer scarf or stole by working fewer or more repeats of the 14-stitch/10-row lace pattern yarn a lace-weight or fingering-weight yarn for a light or medium-light scarf the sample shown is knit with a lace-weight wool/silk blend naturally yarns nz dawn 2 ply 50% wool 50% silk 171 yd/156 m per 25g skein color #8 silver 3 skeins sample used 71 g approximately 486 yds/444 m needles needle size to create fabric you like sample scarf knit on us #4 3 5 mm gauge while gauge is not critical a gauge swatch is highly recommended to determine the needles size you need to create the knit fabric you like sample scarf gauge is 26 st/29 row = 4 inches/10 cm in lace pattern after blocking finished measurements 9½-in wide by 72-in long pattern notes pattern has 1 stitch garter edge on each side with repeats of the 14-st lace pattern between each lace pattern row is worked twice once for side a and once for side b pattern & images © 2021 laura evans page 1 reversible zigzag eyelet lace scarf pattern abbreviations and symbols ssk slip the next 2 stitches 1 by 1 knitwise insert the tip of the left needle from left to right into the fronts of those 2 sts and knit them decrease yo yarn over lace - chart chart is worked from right to left for all row lace written instructions row 1 side a k1 k1 yo ssk k4 p7 to last st k1 row 2 side b repeat row 1 row 3 side a k1 k2 yo ssk k3 p7 to last st k1 row 4 side b repeat row 3 row 5 side a k1 k3 yo ssk k2 p7 to last st k1 row 6 side b repeat row 5 row 7 side a k1 k4 yo ssk k1 p7 to last st k1 row 8 side b repeat row 7 row 9 side a k1 k5 yo ssk p7 to last st k1 row 10 side b repeat row 9 directions cast on 58 st or a multiple of 14 + 2 set-up row k all stitches work row 1-10 of lace pattern 47 times or as many
